definition: gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: "You look fine, " Koppel said when the tape began to roll.
sentences.chinese: “你气色不错，”带子开始转动时科佩尔说。
昨天他们看上去气色好。

sentences.english: Eat your spinach. It will put color in your cheeks.
sentences.chinese: 吃点菠菜，这能让你气色好。

sentences.english: You are emaciated and ill-looking , you are near to death!
sentences.chinese: 你消瘦羸弱，气色不好，死亡已经临近。

sentences.english: Keeping your body healthy may help you maintain a fresh complexion.
sentences.chinese: 身体健康的外在表现便是气色清新。

sentences.english: You know how to interpret the appearance of the sky, but you cannot interpret the signs of the times.
sentences.chinese: 你们知道分辨天上的气色，倒不能分辨这时候的神迹。

sentences.english: I thought he was looking worse than usual lately.
sentences.chinese: 最近我觉得他气色比原来差了。

sentences.english: And Jacob noticed that Laban's attitude toward him was not what it had been.
sentences.chinese: 雅各见拉班的气色向他不如从前了。

sentences.english: While watching the vine is really look.
Do not look too good or not?

sentences.chinese: 你今天看上去气色较好。
你看起来气色不错，有什么好消息吗？

sentences.english: In the elegant light, it naturally brings diner good complexion ruddy.
sentences.chinese: 在雅致的光线之下，自然而然带给食客红润好气色。

sentences.english: You look better after taking the medicine.
sentences.chinese: 你吃过药后气色好得多了。

definition: in glowing spirits (idiom); bursting with life/radiating health and vigor
in high spirits (idiom); glowing with health and vigor
wan and sallow/thin and pallid/haggard/(of plants) withered
variant of 顯擺|显摆[xian3 bai5]
elderly, as in movement or bearing
Guangze county in Nanping 南平[Nan2 ping2] Fujian
